caseName: Zauderer v. Office of Disciplinary Counsel of Supreme Court of Ohio

wikiData.title: Zauderer v. Office of Disciplinary Counsel of Supreme Court of Ohio
wikiData.Litigants: Zauderer v. Office of Disciplinary Counsel of Supreme Court of Ohio
wikiData.FullName: Zauderer v. Office of Disciplinary Counsel of Supreme Court of Ohio
wikiData.Prior: ''Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Zauderer'', 10 Ohio St. 3d 44, 461 N.E.2d 883 (1984); probable jurisdiction noted, {{ussc|469|813|1984|el=no}}.
wikiData.Holding: A State may require advertisers to include "purely factual and uncontroversial" disclosures without violating the First Amendment rights of the advertiser as long as the disclosure is in the State's interest in preventing deception of consumers.
wikiData.JoinMajority: Blackmun, Stevens (in full), Brennan, Marshall (Parts I, II, III, and IV), Burger, Rehnquist, O'Connor (Parts I, II, V, and VI )
